name: Courtyard by Marriott Philadelphia Plymouth Meeting

reviews.text: Maybe the place has new management, but I thought it was really nice. It's not easy to find as the hotel is tucked back in an office park, and as noted, your really need a car to come and go. It was quiet. The room was clean and really comfortable. The small gym had all new equipment (2-3 treadmills, 1 elliptical, 1 bike, free weights). The pool was good sized for a hotel and there was a hot tub that was hot, not lukewarm. The pool room had one wall that was all windows looking out onto a garden area. The breakfast buffet was good with omelets made to order. I would stay here again. I got a great rate: $62/night for 3 night min. stay!
reviews.title: Friendly staff! good attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a friends wedding. I am a Project Manager and book hotel stays frequently for my co-workers and thus know how easy it is to have a taxi called from the front desk or what have you. The reception was about 4 miles from the hotel, and we didn't want to drive. When I called the hotel regarding any services they may have offered, they advised they only offered airport transportation complimentary - not a problem do you have any suggestions? She suggested a few companies for which the cost for a 4 mile ride would have been about $200 - so obviously that wasn't the way we wanted to go. She did say that when we arrived at the hotel that we could ask the front desk to call a cab (I am from the area but know that this is located in the suburbs - not the city and a cab might not be as easily accessible). I said great, how long is the wait typically? She said 20-30 minutes - again - great! So....when we got there I asked the guy at the front desk to call a cab and he looked at me like I had three eyes. He said we don't normally do that...ok fine...but you are a hotel and you don't have a designated conceirge - thus, you take care of guests requests. He advised that "there is only one cab company locally that will pickup for local drives but since they don't want to pick you up for such a close ride they will take almost an hour to get here." No kidding - this is what this guy told me! When I called and talked the first woman - the one I refer to above - I called the actual hotel and front desk - not the main 800 number. I could have argued it and asked for a supervisor but I was going to a wedding, I didn't want to ruin my mood - so I figured the best way to handle it was to write a review. Beware, if you are staying here and don't have transportation - they tell you one thing and when you get there its something different.
reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend to someone without transportation

likes.disliked: — the poor customer service at the front desk

reviews.text: I have stayed at this property twice in the past year, both times for four days or more. The hotel itself is nothing special -- your basic Courtyard, but the grounds are well cared-for and the location in a small corporate park affords it more privacy and quiet than many other area hotels. The staff is very professional and the beds are comfy. No free breakfast, but a Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks are nearby.
reviews.title: Quiet, convenient Courtyard

likes.disliked: — no free breakfast, had to log in to the internet each day

reviews.text: Normally, Courtyard by Marriott has a comfortable bed and a very clean room, but that was not the case for this hotel. Shower curitain had scums, and some of the drinking glasses were very dirty.
reviews.title: Below average Courtyard Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for a business purpose for four nights, and one of the morning, before 8 am, a housekeeping lady came to clean my room while I was still in the room. I had to ask her to come back a short while later.
reviews.title: ok

reviews.text: The fitness room had two very old, not so great treadmills which made a lot of noise.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for price

reviews.text: On a positive side, the hotel is located away from the main street, and relatively quiet even during the day.
reviews.title: Simply EXCELLENT

likes.disliked: — Location is a bit tricky, although close to major interstates

reviews.text: It wasn't a terrible hotel, but for $140 a night, I expected a little more.
reviews.title: 3 staye within a month and very impressed

likes.liked: — Very comfortable rooms and staf was on their game. A PLUS!!

reviews.title: Less than Fair for a Courtyard
reviews.text: I was in the area for about a month and stayed at this hotel 3 separate times during that month. I would of stayed more, but some of my business meeting were a bit far from the hotel and needed to stay closer. This is a very nice Courtyard. What makes it special in my opinion is the staff. They are very friendly and helpful. You can tell management puts an emphasis on their employees and customer satisfaction. The rooms and bed are very nice also and its close to restaurants, shopping and about anything you may need for your stay. I travel atleast 9 months a year and have satyed at many hotel and was impressed with this one.

I have to say, it's the worst Courtyard I've ever stayed at. This is my 3rd time at Plymouth Meeting and my last. The first 2 stays was ok, but this time, it was awful. My first impression was ok and can do. But this time, the shower head was falling off and off the wall, the toilet bowl had some left overs... so gross and the hairdryer was not even mounted on the wall. It was thrown in the closet with the mounting kit and it did not work. The iron looked like it was 20 years old with calcium deposits of about 2mm. The bed was comfortable but the rug looked dirty and sticky. I am a gold member with Marriott and have stayed over 60 nights last year with the Marriott. This would have to be the worst. Mind you, it was less than fair. Worse than some Fairfields. The hotel is in need of good repair. Thumbs down.
reviews.title: Very impressed: comfortable room, helpful staff
Wonderful
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and were not disappointed. The hotel is in an executive park with very beautiful landscaping. There is also a Doubletree hotel right across the way in the same park. It is located less than a quarter of a mile from the Plymouth Meeting mall, so, if you need to do some quick shopping, there it is.

reviews.title: great stay!
reviews.text: The room that we had, a standard room with a king bed, was quite comfortable, at least I found it to be so. My wife felt the mattress was a little too firm. An adequate number of pillows were supplied, and we found it quite easy to get more (as I am a pillow fiend). The pillows were very comfortable.

reviews.title: Great hotel
reviews.text: We found the room to be very clean.

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Philadelphia Plymouth Meeting Hotel
